info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:20PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Whiteside, southeastern Jo Daviess, Carroll, southeastern Jackson and northeastern Clinton Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 319 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Argo Fay, or near Mount Carroll, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Argo Fay around 325 PM CDT. Mount Carroll around 335 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Savanna and Sabula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
